main event: On November 6, 1967, several witnesses in Mexico City, Mexico reported seeing a bright, glowing, disc-shaped object hovering silently over the city's central plaza near the Monumento a la Independencia (The Angel of Independence).
interesting points: The object was described as a large, glowing white mass approximately 40-50 feet in diameter that hovered for several minutes before accelerating rapidly and disappearing.
The incident was investigated by the Mexican Air Force and forwarded to the U.S. Air Force's Project Blue Book, but no definitive explanation was ever determined.
This case is classified as a 'close encounter of the second kind' as the witnesses reported a clear, prolonged observation of an anomalous aerial phenomenon.
Four Mexican Air Force pilots reportedly observed and photographed the disc-shaped craft, which was estimated to be 30-40 feet in diameter and capable of accelerating to 1,800 mph.
No physical trace evidence was found at the site, but the pilots' credible eyewitness accounts and photographic evidence contributed to the unresolved nature of the incident.
witnesses: several civilian witnesses, four Mexican Air Force pilots
photographs: yes, the report includes photographs taken by the Mexican Air Force pilots
